definition.name: NXpositioner
definition.doc: This group describes a generic positioner such as a motor or piezo-electric transducer. It is used to document the current information of a piece of beam line equipment. Note: When using multiple ``NXpositioner`` groups, it is suggested to place them inside a ``NXcollection`` group. In such cases, when ``NXpositioner`` is used in another class, ``NXcollection/NXpositioner`` is then constructed.

field.name: value
field.doc: best known value of positioner - need [n] as may be scanned

field.name: raw_value
field.doc: raw value of positioner - need [n] as may be scanned

field.name: target_value
field.doc: targeted (commanded) value of positioner - need [n] as may be scanned

field.name: tolerance
field.doc: maximum allowable difference between target_value and value

field.name: soft_limit_min
field.doc: minimum allowed limit to set value

field.name: soft_limit_max
field.doc: maximum allowed limit to set value

field.name: velocity
field.doc: velocity of the positioner (distance moved per unit time)

field.name: acceleration_time
field.doc: time to ramp the velocity up to full speed

field.name: controller_record
field.doc: Hardware device record, e.g. EPICS process variable, taco/tango ...
